column4: ok, i thought he meant from a prompt, sorry just caught a glimpse
I'm having hella trouble with using my Intel Easy PC Camera webcam
even after i installed drivers for it
i installed http://spca50x.sourceforge.net/spca50x.php?page=cams and it still wont work with gnome meeting or camorama
whats it doing?
does "lsmod | grep spca" show up anything?
no
well i think its not getting loaded....
try sudo modprobe spca5xx
should i have to do something besides install the .deb?
what exactly did you install?
thats not a driver. thats the source code,
you dont need it.
what do you mean i dont need it
spca5xx?
follow this howto http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=75284&highlight=webcam
it made my webcam work
i did all that and at the end i got
youre not on breezy are you?
no, all i have is hoary CD's
is there a way to update without re-downloading and re-installing
nope..
